site_name: BEARIZONA WILDLIFE PARK, L L C

citations.narrative:
There is inadequate shelter space for 2 outdoor housed brown bears "Aurora" and "Denali". The approximately 2-year-old
female bears have access to a single den constructed out of a hard plastic barrel (volume measuring approximately 1500
gallons). Failure to provide shelter from inclement weather for all animals kept outdoors may result in their discomfort or
incompatibility between the animals. Natural or artificial shelter appropriate to the local climatic conditions for the species
concerned shall be provided for all animals kept outdoors to afford them protection and to prevent discomfort to such
animals.
Correct by 14 October 2025.

There is a fist-sized hole in the bottom corner netting of a primary enclosure for a Red-legged Seriema "Chopstix".
Primary enclosures that are not kept in good repair may create hazards which can injure the birds housed within them or
allow for their escape. Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are
structurally sound. The primary enclosures must be kept in good repair. Corrected at time of inspection.
Correct from this date forward of 23 September 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
